text: The 2015 Sana'a mosque bombings were a series of four suicide bombings. They happened during midday prayers on March 20, 2015 in Sana'a, Yemen, killing 142 people. It left 357 people injured. The mosques were mainly attended by Houthis supporters. The Houthis are the ruling faction in Sana'a. Islamic State later claimed that they were behind the bombings. ==References== Category:2015 in Asia Category:2010s building bombings Category:2010s explosions in Asia Category:2010s in Yemen Category:Attacks on buildings and structures in 2015 Category:Attacks on mosques Category:Attacks on religious buildings and structures in Asia Category:Explosions in 2015 Category:Islamic State Category:Islamic terrorist incidents in 2015 Category:Islamic terrorist incidents in Asia Category:March 2015 events Category:Mass murder in 2015 Category:Mass murder in Asia Category:Suicide bombings in Asia Category:Suicide bombings in the 2010s Category:Terrorist incidents in Asia in the 2010s
title: 2015 Sana'a mosque bombings
